website_summaries.verdict: The Acer Triton 700 is an impressive slim gaming laptop, but its nontraditional touchpad makes it a tough sell for anything other than games.
pros: The Triton 700 fits a powerful Nvidia 1080 GPU into a slim frame
The mechanical keyboard is great, without being too bulky
More ports than you'd expect from a slim laptop
cons: The touchpad is poorly placed and gets too hot while gaming

customer_reviews.title: I love it's solid design
customer_reviews.text: It is a beast. I love it's solid design. The cooling has to be assisted with cooler pad, because after 2 hours of intensive gaming it gets super hot, and starts to frame drop, but it is understandable, it is a very very strong laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Márton ZELNIK

customer_reviews.title: Its a beast
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. This thing is beast. Just a heads up there are no 2.5" SSDs in this and there are no slots for them. Comes with one M.2 installed and room for another. Battlefield, Minecraft, Fallout, Fortnite. All play on Max Settings and are smooth! Battery life is better than i thought it would be for web browsing and spreadsheets on Gaming Laptop. Ofcoase while gaming im always plugged in. If your like me and want to keep on charger at the house and one in your bag they are quite expensive. Overall excellent laptop would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: S. Trobaugh

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: I have been through multiple gaming laptops in the past few months attempting to find the best one. I can not vouch for longevity as I have only been using it for around a week now, but I can absolutely vouch for build quality. This laptop is super fast, extremely well built, and I LOVE the glass trackpad. It is a non conventional trackpad out of the way towards the back of the computer since this laptop will be used with a mouse anyway. It can be used in a pinch for basic productivity work (but who would use it for gaming anyway?). Very technologically advanced. I will update if I ever have any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Logan Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Toll Brothers sent old wrong spec laptop!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two laptops, same specs. Received on different days, second one had wrong specifiactions, did not realize until wasted 3hrs setup and then realized no sparem.2 slot, it had two used slots instead of 1. On further checking also only had 16GB RAM instead of 32GB, and dated 2017/11!!! Very poor QA, not happy with wasted time and effort!
customer_reviews.author: KCxx2

customer_reviews.title: WOULD LIKE TO DO 5 STARS BUT...
customer_reviews.text: My only issue with this laptop is that it runs super hot. I mean hot enough to burn skin. Seems this should be a non-issue these days. Also was advertised as having state of the art cooling system. Far as I can see there is little or no cooling happening with this one! I have to shut down quite often to allow for cooling so long term usage is problematic for sure. Just be advised that this can get dangerously hot.
customer_reviews.author: C. Dunbar

customer_reviews.title: acer support is garbage
customer_reviews.text: This is a high end laptop, and I expect quality customer support for it. But when I called the support line, I had to wait for over 30 minutes, and I spoke to a rep that I could barely understand and who was probably less knowledgeable about computers than me. Chat support was equally useless, suggesting a "fix" that would cost ~$1400. yeah, the computer works great, but the support is infuriatingly poor.
customer_reviews.author: lightswitch

customer_reviews.title: Buyer be ware
customer_reviews.text: Buyer be ware: I brought this laptop and within just 3 uses the screen now shows damage on the lce pixel screen. What I suspect is that after I closed it during just a regular use, the heat from the board and fan damaged the internal liquid. Going to need to send back for service. Which there was some sort if warning not to close the screen immediatelt after use!
customer_reviews.author: Chris J.

customer_reviews.title: Many professional reviews did not do justice
customer_reviews.text: I conducted weeks of research towards a laptop that would meet my gaming and photo editing demands and fit the aesthetic profile. I zeroed in on the Acer Predator Triton 700 15” due to its unique design and material infrastructure and competent abilities. I read many professional reviews and decided the cons “touchpad placement”, “touch pad glass heating issues”, “bezel screen edges”, “No 4-k display” - were not reasons enough to deter me from investing. Whereas I noticed other laptops from major brands having other cons that were more impactful on performance/ease-of-use. No regrets and I have enjoyed the Triton 700 as much as I envisioned.
customer_reviews.author: Orlando

customer_reviews.title: Nice laptop
customer_reviews.text: Perfect laptop, except that the charging wire is not fit here in my country to plug 🔌 it , and any converter will not support the 13A needed by the laptop to work efficient . Plus with games it really get very very hot , so external fan to be connected
customer_reviews.author: Hamada

customer_reviews.title: Dead on arrival.
customer_reviews.text: Did not expect this with Acer High end Laptop.I have Acer Aspire , it runs great .May e Acer laptop is not the choice for high end Gaming
customer_reviews.author: silent warrior

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: So happy with this powerful laptop. Super fast and thinner than I would have guessed. Especially with how powerful this machine is. It gets hot with usage so I would suggest a cooling pad with it.
customer_reviews.author: Roberto

customer_reviews.title: Powerfull machine
customer_reviews.text: Great product, worth the price. Everything worked as it was supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: vitaliy belyushin

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This is great laptop. Does everything I want it to. Boots up very fast. I use it for serious gaming with some light streaming. Battery life is a weak point. Battery last about an hour when not plugged in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Battery
customer_reviews.text: Good labtop, I bought the very good condition but has a little screen issue. But still no problem running programs Good price for good spec
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Kim

customer_reviews.title: Great gaming laptop
customer_reviews.text: This laptop is great for gaming my only concerns is that the left shift button sometimes gets stuck when I try to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Traplone

customer_reviews.title: Much better condition than one would expect.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in (Used - Acceptable Condition) the only imperfection was a small dent on the lid. This was by far the best purchase decision I have ever made on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Amazing laptop with little to no battery life
customer_reviews.text: Awesome laptop for gaming, but just remember to have your charger!
customer_reviews.author: Huan Huynh

customer_reviews.title: Ubuntu cannot be installed on this machine.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to use this machine for analytics and data science. However, because of proprietary drivers and what I can only assume is collusion by Microsoft and intel, Ubuntu is incompatible, making this machine useless for users like me. The design is cool though, and had I been able to install Ubuntu, I probably would have enjoyed using this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of power without all that annoying gaming laptop branding
customer_reviews.text: This thing is incredible. Plenty of power without all that annoying gaming laptop branding. My only complaint is the sub 3 hour battery life but I know that’s because of the combination of slim form factor and immense power.
customer_reviews.author: Jayce

customer_reviews.title: This laptop is a beast!
customer_reviews.text: This laptop is a beast! It’s also a great size. Very portable.
customer_reviews.author: James Youngblood

customer_reviews.title: Worth.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Don't be put off by the 1 or 2 bad reviews by people complaining about irrelevant issues.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Besinaiz

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Amazing quality build and very distinctive design. Computer manages to maintain his frequencies even under heavy games and stress tests. I don’t know how acer managed that but some laptops cannot hold up even with a 1070 maxq. And also the shipping was lightning fast. I love the tactile feel of the keyboard but the travel distance of the keys is far less than a usual mech keyboard anyway the feeling is still nice and crispy.
customer_reviews.author: Igor

customer_reviews.title: So/so
customer_reviews.text: The specs are amazing for this machine but the trackpad gets super hot and burned my finger tips and the keyboard is a little to far back from the screen.
customer_reviews.author: Bruno R.

customer_reviews.title: Worst computer ever
customer_reviews.text: Worst computer ever. Overpriced, terrible build quality. The track pad is worst I have ever used, it doesnt work half the time. The battery lasts about an hour and the fans are loud at idle.
customer_reviews.author: Clay

customer_reviews.title: Wow! so good
customer_reviews.text: Currently playing far cry new dawn maxed, so pretty. Really loving this thing. Thanks Acer!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 4 1/2 Stars for an Outstanding Laptop
customer_reviews.text: This is really an outstanding, if expensive, laptop. I'm giving it 4 1/2 stars. I'm taking 1/2 a star off due to the ridiculous touchpad location and characteristics. As other reviewers have noted, placing the touchpad above the keyboard is an ergonomic disaster. I simply do not understand why this was done and suspect it has to be some engineering issue because otherwise no computer user would ever do this. Other than that however I can find nothing to complain about and many things to rave about. The speed is simply outstanding. The screen is exceptional. The keyboard is good and responsive. The fans are superb and quiet. Highly recommended if you can afford it.
customer_reviews.author: Book Fanatic

customer_reviews.title: Acer Support do not help
customer_reviews.text: The laptop itself is great. However, I had an issue with the keyboard and Acer support refused to help. Thus, I was obligated to return it for a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Acer Predator Triton 700 PT715-51-732Q Ultra-Thin Gaming Laptop, 15.6” FHD 120Hz G-SYNC, i7-7700HQ, Overclockable GeForce GTX 1080 8GB MAX-Q Design, 32GB DDR4, 512GB SSD (256GBx2), RGB Mech KB
product_meta.description: Style:2 x 256GB SSDAcer Predator Triton 700 PT715-51-732Q Gaming Laptop comes with these high level specs: 7th Generation Intel Core i7-7700HQ Processor 2.8GHz with Turbo Boost Technology up to 3.8GHz, 15.6" Full HD (1920 x 1080) widescreen LED-backlit IPS display with NVIDIA G-SYNC technology, NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1080 with MAX-Q design & 8 GB of dedicated GDDR5X VRAM, 32GB DDR4 2400MHz Memory, 512GB PCIe SSD in RAID 0 configuration (2 x 256GB), Optimized Dolby Atmos sound enhancement, Acer True Harmony Technology, Two Built-in Stereo Speakers, Secure Digital (SD) card reader, Killer Double Shot Pro Wireless-AC 1535 802.11ac. WiFi featuring 2x2 MU-MIMO technology (Dual-Band 2.4GHz and 5GHz), Killer Ethernet E2500 10/100/1000 Gigabit Ethernet LAN (RJ-45 port), HD Webcam (1280 x 720) supporting High Dynamic Range (SHDR), 1 - Thunderbolt 3 (Full USB 3.1 Type C) Port, 3 - USB 3.0 Port One with Power-off Charging), 1 - USB 2.0 Port, 1 - HDMI 2.0 Port with HDCP Support, 1 - Display Port, 3-cell Li-ion Battery (4670 mAh), Up to 2-hours Battery Life, 5.4 lbs. | 2.45 kg (system unit only) (NH.Q2LAA.001). Network - Wireless LAN Standard - IEEE 802.11ac. Operating System Architecture 64-bit and Maximum Power Supply Wattage 230 W.
feature_bullets: 7th Generation Intel Core i7-7700HQ Processor (Up to 3.8GHz)
NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1080 with MAX-Q design & 8 GB of dedicated GDDR5X VRAM
15.6" Full HD (1920 x 1080) LED-backlit IPS 120Hz Refresh Rate Display with NVIDIA G-SYNC technology
32GB DDR4 Memory & 512GB PCIe SSD in RAID 0 configuration
Dual All-Metal Aero Blade 3D Fans with 5 Copper Heat Pipes | VR Ready | Customizable RGB Mechanical KB | LAN: Killer Gaming Network E2500 | Wireless: Killer Double Shot pro Wireless-AC 1535 802.11ac
